001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
005import java.util.function.Function;
006
007import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
008
009import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheConfig;
010import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheContentType;
011import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheType;
012
013/**
014 * An Escaper is an {@link Appender} used to escape content such as HTML. A
015 * {@link Formatter} is usually what will call the Escaper and like a formatter it should
016 * be singleton like and expect reuse.
017 * <p>
018 * When a template outputs an <strong>escaped</strong> variable the callstack is as
019 * follows:
020 *
021 * <pre>
022 * formatter --&gt; escaper --&gt; appendable
023 * </pre>
024 *
025 * Escapers are also a {@code Function<String,String>} to allow compatibility with
026 * {@link JStacheType#STACHE zero dependency generated code} that expects Escapers to be
027 * of type {@code Function<String,String>}.
028 * <p>
029 *
030 * If performance is not a concern an easier way to create an implementation is to adapt a
031 * function by using {@link #of(Function)}.
032 * <p>
033 * To implement a custom escaper:
034 *
035 * <ol>
036 * <li>Implement this interface or use {@link #of(Function)}.</li>
037 * <li>Register the custom escaper. See {@link JStacheContentType}.</li>
038 * <li>Set {@link JStacheConfig#contentType()} to the class that has the
039 * {@link JStacheContentType}.</li>
040 * </ol>
041 *
042 * @apiNote Implementations should be threadsafe and expect reuse!
043 * @see JStacheContentType
044 * @author agentgt
045 */
046public non-sealed interface Escaper extends Appender, Function<String, String> {
047
048        /**
049         * Escapes a String by using StringBuilder and calling
050         * {@link #append(Output, CharSequence)}.
051         * <p>
052         * This method is to make Escaper implementations compatible with
053         * {@link JStacheType#STACHE zero dependency generated code} that expects Escapers to
054         * be {@code Function<String,String>}.
055         * @param t String to ge escaped.
056         * @return escaped content
057         * @throws UncheckedIOException if the appender or appendable throw an
058         * {@link IOException}
059         */
060        @Override
061        default String apply(String t) throws UncheckedIOException {
062                var out = new Output.StringOutput(new StringBuilder());
063                append(out, t);
064                return out.toString();
065        }
066
067        /**
068         * Escapes the characters if it needs it. {@inheritDoc}
069         */
070        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, CharSequence s) throws E;
071
072        /**
073         * Escapes the characters if it needs it. {@inheritDoc}
074         */
075        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, CharSequence csq, int start, int end) throws E;
076
077        /**
078         * Escapes the character if it needs escaping. {@inheritDoc}
079         */
080        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, char c) throws E;
081
082        /**
083         * Escapes the character if it needs escaping. The default implementation will
084         * {@link String#valueOf(short)} and call {@link #append(Output, CharSequence)}.
085         * {@inheritDoc}
086         */
087        @Override
088        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, short s) throws E {
089                append(a, String.valueOf(s));
090        }
091
092        /**
093         * Escapes the character if it needs escaping. The default implementation will
094         * {@link String#valueOf(int)} and call {@link #append(Output, CharSequence)}.
095         * {@inheritDoc}
096         */
097        @Override
098        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, int i) throws E {
099                append(a, String.valueOf(i));
100        }
101
102        /**
103         * Escapes the character if it needs escaping. The default implementation will
104         * {@link String#valueOf(long)} and call {@link #append(Output, CharSequence)}.
105         * {@inheritDoc}
106         */
107        @Override
108        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, long l) throws E {
109                append(a, String.valueOf(l));
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * Escapes the character if it needs escaping. The default implementation will
114         * {@link String#valueOf(double)} and call {@link #append(Output, CharSequence)}.
115         * {@inheritDoc}
116         */
117        @Override
118        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, double d) throws E {
119                append(a, String.valueOf(d));
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * Escapes the character if it needs escaping. The default implementation will
124         * {@link String#valueOf(boolean)} and call {@link #append(Output, CharSequence)}.
125         * {@inheritDoc}
126         */
127        @Override
128        default <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, boolean b) throws E {
129                append(a, String.valueOf(b));
130        }
131
132        /**
133         * Adapts a function to an Escaper.
134         *
135         * If the function is already an Escaper then it is simply returned (noop). Thus it is
136         * safe to repeatedly call this on an Escaper. If the function is adapted the returned
137         * adapted Escaper will convert native types with {@code String.valueOf} first and
138         * then apply the escape function.
139         * @param escapeFunction returned if it is already an escaper
140         * @return adapted Escaper
141         */
142        public static Escaper of(Function<String, String> escapeFunction) {
143                if (escapeFunction instanceof Escaper e) {
144                        return e;
145                }
146                return new FunctionEscaper(escapeFunction);
147
148        }
149
150}
151
152class FunctionEscaper implements Escaper {
153
154        private final Function<String, String> function;
155
156        public FunctionEscaper(Function<String, String> function) {
157                super();
158                this.function = function;
159        }
160
161        @Override
162        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, CharSequence s) throws E {
163                a.append(function.apply(s.toString()));
164        }
165
166        @Override
167        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, @Nullable CharSequence csq, int start, int end)
168                        throws E {
169                if (csq == null) {
170                        a.append(function.apply("null"));
171                        return;
172                }
173                a.append(function.apply(String.valueOf(csq.subSequence(start, end))));
174        }
175
176        @Override
177        public <A extends Output<E>, E extends Exception> void append(A a, char c) throws E {
178                append(a, String.valueOf(c));
179        }
180
181}
